page.title: 03Housing Stanton-in-Peak'
page.content: 'My house is the Village Post Office and general stores. It was built in 1932. My mother is the post mistress' .. 'Our cottage is more than 3OO years old. It is a listed building. Upstairs were two big rooms with high beamed ceilings. Downstairs is one room with a low oak beamed ceiling, a kitchen with a stone sink and a small pantry, lots of stone shelves and hooks for pig salting. Outside was a chemical toilet in a shed. The windows are stone mullioned, arched at the top. On the gable end are some large stones sticking out like steps - witches' steps. Long ago people believed that if a witch came to the house she would climb the steps and go over the roof to the next house. My dad who is a builder, has fitted an upstairs bathroom and added an extension downstairs.'
